jobs.title: Snapp - Senior Software Engineer, iOS
tasks: Design a roadmap on how to avoid negative impact of code changes across 2 shared products, each supporting 2 distinct projects.
Supervise chapter-wide testing strategy deployment and mentor 20 engineers by hosting workshops and 1o1 troubleshooting.
Consult architectural refinements.
Refactor and implement integration tests on internal frameworks.
Implement face recognition and accessibility features utilizing Vision Framework following VIPER in composition with micro-services.

jobs.title: Namava - Senior iOS Engineer
tasks: Designed and deployed 12 iOS SDKs, implementing Clean Architecture principles to ensure modularity and scalability. These SDKs are now a cornerstone of our mobile apps, used across two projects.

Architected a modular design with clear APIs, enabling colleagues to develop features with less code and greater reliability. This approach was driven by the principles of SAP (Stable Abstraction Principle) , CCP (Common Closure Principle) , and CRP (Common Reuse Principle).
Implemented a custom Video Player within the new modular design, wrapping AVPlayer. This player has been highly praised for its performance and reliability, surpassing our Android and Web platforms.
Led the rewrite of the project using SwiftUI and Combine, transitioning from UIKit and RxSwift, and adding support for iPad. This rewrite emphasized software stability.
Applied SOLID principles and Protocol-Oriented Programming to design a flexible and maintainable codebase, following Clean Code practices to improve readability and reduce complexity.
Utilized TDD (Test-Driven Development) to enforce high-quality code standards, resulting in a significant reduction in bugs and ensuring the delivery of reliable and flawless features.
Emphasized DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) and KISS (Keep It Simple, Stupid) principles in code reviews and development practices, leading to cleaner and more efficient code.

Conducted technical interviews as part of a two-step hiring process, including knowledge-based assessments and live coding or home assignments, contributing to the successful hiring of two iOS engineers.
Deployed primitive CI/CD using Fastlane and GitLab CI, ensuring sufficient test coverage and seamless releases.

jobs.title: StrAIberry - iOS Engineer
tasks: Followed the MVVM-C architectural pattern to ensure clean and maintainable code, supported by end-to-end tests to validate functionality.

Developed and integrated advanced features such as object detection and target image capture using Vision framework, Core ML, TF-Lite, and LibTorch, following the evolution of our machine learning models.

Created custom charts with Core Graphics and Core Animation and other key app functionalities including push notifications, secure user authentication via Cognito, and a customized reminder system using Core Data and EventKit.

jobs.title: Urmis - iOS Developer
tasks: Developed e-commerce applications using the MVVM architectural pattern and Test-Driven Development (TDD) principles, working towards testable code.
Programmatically composed user interfaces with UIKit and AutoLayout, optimizing for both iPhone and iPad screen sizes.
Identified and resolved performance bottlenecks using Instruments, optimizing memory and CPU usage with Grand Central Dispatch (GCD) techniques.
Implemented real-time delivery tracking features using MapKit, setting both smoothness and energy impact as priorities.

jobs.title: Self-Employed - Software Developer
tasks: Engaged by six clients to develop and maintain iOS and cross-platform projects across various sectors including education, e-commerce, surveying, and food; utilizing Swift, React Native and Flutter.
Collaborated with clients to understand their needs and translate them into functional and user-friendly features.
Worked with a team of 7 to produce PvP and hypercasual in-house games using Unity3D.
Developed and maintained a Node.js backend with socket.io and MongoDB, supporting real-time multiplayer game functionality.
